entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 29 at 9:12PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Winds And Blowing Snow Monday Through Wednesday... A series of storm systems moving into the southern Bering Sea will bring strong east winds along with blowing snow and reduced visibility to the West Coast through much of the early to middle part of next week. The first storm system impacting the area will move into Bristol Bay on Monday and bring strong east winds and

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 30 at 2:36AM CST until December 30 at 3:00PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow. Snow accumulations of up to two inches. * WHERE...Higher elevations of the East Tennessee mountains, generally at or above 3000 feet elevation. * WHEN...Until 4 PM EST Saturday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Blount Smoky Mountains; Cocke Smoky Mountains; Johnson; Sevier Smoky Mountains; Southeast Carter; Southeast Greene; Southeast Monroe; Unicoi

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued December 30 at 4:59AM PST until December 31 at 4:00AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Sneaker waves possible. * WHERE...In Oregon, North Oregon Coast and Central Oregon Coast. In Washington, South Washington Coast. * WHEN...Through late tonight.

entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued December 30 at 3:12AM PST until December 30 at 12:00PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST TODAY... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. * WHERE...In Oregon, Foothills of the Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon. In Washington, Lower Columbia Basin of Washington and Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington. * WHEN...Until noon PST today.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington; Lower Columbia Basin of Washington

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. * WHERE...Eastern Preston and Eastern Tucker Counties. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 30 at 8:28AM EST until December 30 at 7:00PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. Total snow accumulation 2 to 4 inches Westerly winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...In Maryland, Garrett County. In West Virginia, Western Grant County.
